questions.text: A clinician discussing Germ theory emphasised that many infectious diseases are caused by the presence and activity of microscopic microorganisms, or germs, that invade the body. Whose work laid the foundation for these discussions?

A policymaker receives the following evaluation of two pandemic response programs: Program A: ₹50 crore, prevents 2,000 deaths, cost/death averted = ₹2.5 lakh Program B: ₹55 crore, prevents 1,800 deaths, but gains 10,000 healthy life years (QALYs) by reducing disability and mental distress. Which of the following interpretations is the most appropriate?

options.label: A
options.text: Program A is superior because of lower cost per death

options.label: B
options.text: Program B offers better utility and must be chosen if prioritizing QALYs

options.label: C
options.text: Both programs qualify equally under Cost-Minimization

options.label: D
options.text: CBA should be used to assess cost per rupee spent

questions.correct_answer: B. Program B offers better utility and must be chosen if prioritizing QALYs
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Program B offers better utility and must be chosen if prioritizing QALYs

questions.text: An evaluation report states: “The program has not only met its goal of reducing anaemia but has also finally indirectly contributed to improved school attendance in adolescent girls.” Which element of health planning is best represented by the underlined portion?

A 23-year-old Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) in a rural PHC reports on different aspects of various health programs. The indicators used to assess her work in the village include? Reduction of IMR Malaria cases detected per year Leprosy cases detected per year TB cases detected per year Rates of malnutrition

A district public health audit finds that trained community-based health workers are offering essential care without formal degrees, and a referral grid has been created linking villages to PHCs and taluka hospitals. This decentralized, stratified design was most likely inspired by which two sequential committees?
Which of the following pairs of occupational agents and cancer sites is incorrectly matched?
Duration of sickness benefit under ESI act is:
A juvenile court judge is deciding between sending a boy to a certified school or a borstal. Which of the following most clearly distinguishes a borstal from a certified school?

options.label: A
options.text: Borstals are only for female juvenile delinquents

options.label: C
options.text: Borstals function under the Child Welfare Committee

options.label: D
options.text: Borstals are for juveniles who are unmanageable or misbehaving in certified schools

questions.correct_answer: D. Borstals are for juveniles who are unmanageable or misbehaving in certified schools
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Borstals are for juveniles who are unmanageable or misbehaving in certified schools

questions.text: A woman wants to use combined OCP pills as contraception. Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct_answer: D. Ethinyl estradiol 30 mcg, LNG 150 mcg
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Ethinyl estradiol 30 mcg, LNG 150 mcg

questions.text: A public health fellow is evaluating national demographic surveillance strategies. She is studying India’s Sample Registration System (SRS) to understand how fertility and mortality estimates are generated in rural areas. She finds that SRS involves dividing the population into groups based on certain characteristics and then randomly sampling from within each of them. Which of the following best describes the sampling design used in SRS?

A pregnant woman at 22 weeks gestation is diagnosed with a fetal anomaly incompatible with life. However, she wishes to continue her pregnancy. According to the MTP Amendment Act, 2021, what is the most appropriate recommendation?

options.label: A
options.text: Proceed with MTP after obtaining the opinion of two medical practitioners

options.label: B
options.text: Inform her that MTP is mandatory for fetal anomalies beyond 20 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Respect her autonomy and allow the pregnancy to continue if she wishes

options.label: D
options.text: Seek Medical Board approval and proceed with termination

questions.correct_answer: C. Respect her autonomy and allow the pregnancy to continue if she wishes
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Respect her autonomy and allow the pregnancy to continue if she wishes

questions.text: The image of the mascot ‘Sapna’ shown below and identify what does she represent in the national health program:

options.label: A
options.text: NLEP, leprosy has a vaccine available

options.label: C
options.text: NLEP, Leprosy is curable, reduce stigma, spread awareness

questions.correct_answer: C. NLEP, Leprosy is curable, reduce stigma, spread awareness
questions.explanation: Ans. C) NLEP, Leprosy is curable, reduce stigma, spread awareness

questions.text: A health officer is planning an interschool awareness program in collaboration with the National Deworming Program. So he will have to align his awareness programs keeping the following important days in mind:
A government health worker receives the pamphlet shown in the image. Which of the following health programs is represented by this logo?
During a household visit, an ASHA identifies a pregnant woman with blurring of vision and swelling of feet. What should the ASHA immediately do, based on her roles?

options.label: A
options.text: Provide iron tablets and monitor at home

options.label: B
options.text: Refer to ANM only if BP is >140/90

options.label: C
options.text: Counsel danger signs and escort to nearest facility

options.label: D
options.text: Advise bed rest and hydration for 72 hours

questions.correct_answer: C. Counsel danger signs and escort to nearest facility
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Counsel danger signs and escort to nearest facility

questions.text: A public health policy analyst is reviewing progress toward the Global Strategy for Women’s, Children’s and Adolescent’s Health (2016–2030). The strategy outlines three primary pillars: Survive, Thrive, and Perform. Which of the following age groups are targeted as adolescents in India?

A 16-year-old girl is assessed for obesity using skinfold herpenden calipers. The examiner measures the biceps, triceps, sub-scapular, and suprailiac regions. The sum of skinfolds is 52 mm. Based on the provided data, which of the following is the most appropriate interpretation?

options.label: A
options.text: She meets the global criterion for Grade I obesity

options.label: B
options.text: She is obese based on skinfold assessment cutoffs

options.label: C
options.text: She requires bioelectrical impedance for confirmation

options.label: D
options.text: Skinfolds are not valid in females; use BMI instead

questions.correct_answer: B. She is obese based on skinfold assessment cutoffs
questions.explanation: Ans. B) She is obese based on skinfold assessment cutoffs

questions.text: Based on this life cycle, which of the following diseases is most accurately represented?
Best indicator for chronic malnutrition in children is:

A district reports the following over the past 3 years: ANC/PTCT prevalence consistently <1% Prevalence among MSM and female sex workers (FSWs) in the same district >6% Which category should this district fall under as per national HIV classification?
In a normal distribution for weights of a class of 200 college students, Mean value is 82 kg. The calculated SD is 1.5 kg. Calculate the range of weight for 68% students covering 1 SD:
Match the flea surveillance index with its correct definition:

A 7-year-old boy weighing 20 kg is bitten by a stray dog on the face. Category III exposure is confirmed. According to national guidelines, what is the total dose of human rabies immunoglobulin (HRIG) required?

Under the Accelerated Plan for Elimination of Lymphatic Filariasis (APELF 2018 India strategy), the use of DEC-medicated salt has been recommended in some regions. What is the most appropriate justification for this intervention?

options.label: A
options.text: It eliminates the need for repeated vector control measures

options.label: B
options.text: It improves compliance by passive, continuous drug delivery

options.label: C
options.text: It acts as a preventive vaccine substitute in high-burden districts

options.label: D
options.text: It reduces side effects by bypassing first-pass metabolism

questions.correct_answer: B. It improves compliance by passive, continuous drug delivery
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It improves compliance by passive, continuous drug delivery

questions.text: In a class trip there were 75 camper school students, of which 50 had been immunized for Measles previously. During the trip, a child developed Measles. Subsequently, upon returning home, 12 more children developed Measles. Calculate the Secondary attack rate for Measles.

A new depression scale is tested alongside an existing DXARD scale to ensure that the validity is tested. Sensitivity and specificity are compared too. DXARD scale is the Gold Standard scale-based test for Depression. Which type of validity does this support?
Assertion (A): MMR vaccine is contraindicated in pregnant females. Reason (R): MMR vaccine viruses can cross placenta and harm the foetus.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is true, but R is false

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are false

questions.correct_answer: C. A is true, but R is false
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A is true, but R is false

questions.text: Regarding Incubation periods, identify which of the following statements are true (T) or false (F): Measles IP > Cholera IP. Measles IP > TB IP Yellow fever IP = Diphtheria IP Leprosy IP is highly variable

A clinical investigator designs a randomized controlled trial to evaluate the efficacy of a new antidiabetic drug. Participants are randomly assigned to receive either the investigational drug or a placebo. Which of the following best explains the primary rationale for including a control group in this type of experimental study?

options.label: A
options.text: To ethically accommodate participants who decline experimental intervention

options.label: B
options.text: To expand the sample size and improve statistical modeling power

options.label: C
options.text: To control for confounding and isolate the true effect of the intervention

options.label: D
options.text: To minimize the risk of incorrectly accepting a false null hypothesis

questions.correct_answer: C. To control for confounding and isolate the true effect of the intervention
questions.explanation: Ans. C) To control for confounding and isolate the true effect of the intervention

questions.text: Among the risk factors listed, which one provides the most precise estimate of association with the outcome?
Given the clear linear trend shown in the scatter plot, ‘r’ will lie between?
Which choice is most consistent with the shape of the population pyramid shown?
questions.correct_answer: C. Developing country with high fertility
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Developing country with high fertility

questions.text: A pharmaceutical team is deciding which treatment group shows the most consistent response. Which group likely exhibits the normal distribution with outliers?

While using the sufficient component cause model in Alzheimer’s research, scientists identify multiple component causes in various sufficient causes, but some slots in the pies remain unidentified. What does this imply?

options.label: A
options.text: The disease cannot be classified until all components are discovered

options.label: B
options.text: Unknown causes invalidate the use of the model

options.label: C
options.text: The model allows for action on known factors even if some components are unknown

options.label: D
options.text: No intervention should be initiated until full causal understanding is reached

questions.correct_answer: C. The model allows for action on known factors even if some components are unknown
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The model allows for action on known factors even if some components are unknown

questions.text: A longitudinal study finds that exposure to a new pesticide is associated with a higher incidence of a rare neurological disorder. The association is found across multiple geographic regions and populations using different study designs. Which of the following criteria of Hill’s causality does this most strongly support?

Which of the following statements regarding delayed immunization are true? BCG is always given in children >1 year. DPT can be given till 7 years of age. Vitamin A dose is 1 lac IU for children ≥18 months. JE-1 is included till 15 years of age

A public health officer conducts an inspection of a dairy plant where milk is thermally treated to ensure microbial safety without compromising taste or nutrition. She wants to use Flash method. What temperature-time combination best corresponds to this pasteurization protocol?
Humans serve as dead-end hosts in which of the following infections?
For ASHA worker in an urban area, what is the recommended population norm?

A primary health center (PHC) in a malaria-endemic region reports persistently high transmission rates despite widespread distribution of insecticide-treated bed nets (ITBNs). Upon field inspection, the distributed nets are found to have hole diameters of 0.05 inches and a mesh density of 100 holes per square inch. Insecticide residue is confirmed present on the nets. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for the continued vector transmission?

options.label: A
options.text: The nets were not re-impregnated with insecticide at the recommended interval

options.label: B
options.text: The mesh size of each hole exceeds WHO’s upper limit for effective vector barrier

options.label: C
options.text: The polymer fabric failed to bind deltamethrin adequately, reducing mosquito knock-down rate

options.label: D
options.text: The hole density per square inch is below the optimal mesh threshold for vector exclusion

questions.correct_answer: D. The hole density per square inch is below the optimal mesh threshold for vector exclusion
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The hole density per square inch is below the optimal mesh threshold for vector exclusion

questions.text: Which of the following institutions is primarily responsible for overseeing the implementation of the AMR Containment program in India?

A 40-year-old woman working as a typist reports fatigue. She is neither pregnant nor lactating. Her height is 160 cm and her weight is 55 kg. What is her recommended daily energy intake according to her current occupational activity?

During a water quality surveillance program, a public health microbiologist conducts a multiple-tube fermentation test to estimate coliform contamination in municipal drinking water. After incubating varying dilutions across triplicate tubes, the number of positive tubes is recorded. To derive the most probable number (MPN) index for coliforms per 100 mL, which of the following reference tools should be used?
What is the most accurate description of sickness absenteeism?

options.label: A
options.text: Number of days missed due to confirmed illness only

options.label: B
options.text: A surveillance measure of hospital-acquired infections

options.label: C
options.text: An index for evaluating industrial worker well-being

options.label: D
options.text: Measurement of staff turnover in public sector

questions.correct_answer: C. An index for evaluating industrial worker well-being
questions.explanation: Ans. C) An index for evaluating industrial worker well-being

questions.text: In a multicenter trial, two groups are compared for a new lipid-lowering drug. Group A has SD = 6 and n = 100; Group B has SD = 8 and n = 200. What is the standard error of difference between their means?

A clinical trial investigates the effectiveness of an iron-fortified meal plan on anemia rates in a cohort of 100 schoolchildren. Hemoglobin status (anemic vs. non-anemic) is recorded for each child before and after the 6-month intervention. The data is expressed in paired proportions rather than continuous values. Which of the following statistical tests is most appropriate for analyzing this dataset?

options.label: A
options.text: Wilcoxon rank sum test, to compare non-parametric distributions across two independent groups

options.label: B
options.text: Sign test, to evaluate the direction of change in paired categorical outcomes

options.label: C
options.text: Chi-square test, to assess independence between pre- and post-intervention anemia status

options.label: D
options.text: Mann-Whitney U test, to compare median hemoglobin values across groups

questions.correct_answer: B. Sign test, to evaluate the direction of change in paired categorical outcomes
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Sign test, to evaluate the direction of change in paired categorical outcomes

questions.text: A research analyst compares four different datasets to assess the strength of linear relationships between various clinical variables and patient outcomes. The correlation coefficients are listed below. Which of the following reflects the strongest degree of linear association, regardless of direction?

options.label: A
options.text: The relationship between HDL levels and systolic blood pressure: +0.25

options.label: B
options.text: The relationship between fasting glucose and insulin resistance index: –0.89

options.label: C
options.text: The relationship between BMI and left ventricular mass index: +0.60

options.label: D
options.text: The relationship between dietary salt intake and calcium excretion: –0.10

questions.correct_answer: B. The relationship between fasting glucose and insulin resistance index: –0.89
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The relationship between fasting glucose and insulin resistance index: –0.89

questions.text: A multicenter randomized controlled trial is planned to evaluate a novel anticoagulant’s ability to prevent stroke in patients with atrial fibrillation. The researchers aim to ensure a high probability of detecting a true treatment effect if it exists. They consult a statistician who suggests several strategies. Which of the following changes—if implemented independently and with all other parameters held constant—would most directly result in increased statistical power while reducing the risk of Type II error?

options.label: A
options.text: Widening the confidence interval by increasing the alpha threshold and reducing the sample size

options.label: B
options.text: Lowering the Type I error rate while holding beta constant at 0.2 and maintaining effect size

options.label: C
options.text: Increasing the number of participants, thus narrowing the standard error and reducing beta

options.label: D
options.text: Narrowing the effect size to focus on clinically minimal differences, while preserving sample size and alpha

questions.correct_answer: C. Increasing the number of participants, thus narrowing the standard error and reducing beta
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Increasing the number of participants, thus narrowing the standard error and reducing beta

questions.text: A 58-year-old man with type 2 diabetes undergoes retinal screening using both a conventional OCT scanner and a new AI-based retinal scanner. Based on the ROC curve as shown in the image, which of the following is the most accurate interpretation?

options.label: A
options.text: The AI scanner maintains a lower false positive rate than OCT at all thresholds

options.label: B
options.text: The AI scanner is only more useful when disease prevalence exceeds 30%

options.label: C
options.text: The AI scanner is expected to show an equal false positive rate than the OCT scanner

options.label: D
options.text: The AI scanner is expected to show a higher false positive rate than the OCT scanner

questions.correct_answer: A. The AI scanner maintains a lower false positive rate than OCT at all thresholds
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The AI scanner maintains a lower false positive rate than OCT at all thresholds

questions.text: During a simulated biosecurity threat audit, a health intelligence unit is asked to prioritize agents for sentinel surveillance enhancement due to their silent onset, food/water dissemination potential, and diagnostic ambiguity. Which category of bioterrorism agents should be flagged as highest concern?
Particle diameter size most commonly responsible for causation of Pneumoconioses in industries is?
Which of the following vaccines is contraindicated in pregnancy?
Identify A and B in the image given:

In a study based in Delhi from 2012-2022, doctors followed up 100 people who did exercise on a daily basis for a year. Later, they checked who all had developed coronary heart disease among them. This is a type of:
What is the f-IPV dose schedule under the National Immunization Schedule of India?

options.label: B
options.text: At birth, 6 weeks, 10 weeks, 14 weeks, 16-24 months, 5 years

questions.text: Management of an HIV-positive patient with multiple punctured wound bites caused by a dog is:
questions.correct_answer: C. Rabies vaccine + Immunoglobulin + Wound management
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Rabies vaccine + Immunoglobulin + Wound management

questions.text: A person’s father had colon cancer. He was having bloody stool. So, he just came for the check-up. Before, he had not undergone any screening. He was recommended to do colonoscopy screening. Screening is which level of prevention?
The image regarding health care system levels in the country. Correct arrangement about the levels of health care is:

options.label: A
options.text: Medical colleges and hospitals are primary level, CHC is secondary level, Subcentre and PHC are tertiary level

options.label: B
options.text: Subcentre and PHC are primary level, CHC is secondary level, Medical colleges and hospitals are tertiary level

options.label: C
options.text: CHC is primary level, Subcentre and PHC are secondary level, Medical colleges and hospitals are tertiary level

options.label: D
options.text: CHC is primary level, Medical colleges and hospitals are secondary level, Subcentre and PHC are tertiary level

questions.correct_answer: B. Subcentre and PHC are primary level, CHC is secondary level, Medical colleges and hospitals are tertiary level
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Subcentre and PHC are primary level, CHC is secondary level, Medical colleges and hospitals are tertiary level

questions.text: International health agency - DANIDA is supporting which health program of India?
A group organized a mass gathering on handwashing awareness. Arrange the steps in the correct chronological sequence:
questions.correct_answer: B. Awareness - Interest - Evaluation - Trial - Adoption
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Awareness - Interest - Evaluation - Trial - Adoption

questions.text: It is being planned to put posters in the whole city for health promotion. Which type of health education approach is this?

Mr. X got married to Ms. Y in 1999. They had overall two children - Ms. M in 2002 and Ms. N in 2009. Mr. X’s father was a bank employee who moved in, post-retirement in 2008, with them along with his wife. Which stage of the family cycle do they belong to?
Under Integrated Disease Surveillance Program, which of the following diseases are covered under Sentinel surveillance?
Which of the following guidelines are true for the client post-vasectomy?

options.label: A
options.text: Barrier methods for 4 months and then Semen analysis to confirm

options.label: B
options.text: Barrier methods for 3 months and then Semen analysis to confirm

options.label: C
options.text: Barrier methods for 4 months with no need to come back

options.label: D
options.text: Barrier methods for 3 months with no need to come back

questions.correct_answer: B. Barrier methods for 3 months and then Semen analysis to confirm
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Barrier methods for 3 months and then Semen analysis to confirm

questions.text: Which of the following is not a food adulteration disease?
Which of the following is the correct reason for why f-IPV is preferred over OPV?

options.label: A
options.text: IPV is more efficacious in combating epidemics

options.label: D
options.text: Only OPV is associated with paralysis

questions.correct_answer: D. Only OPV is associated with paralysis
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Only OPV is associated with paralysis

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman opts for the contraceptive method shown in the image but is concerned about possible side effects. Which of the following is the most common side effect associated with this contraceptive?
A laboratory technician is working with a strain of Yersinia pestis that can cause lethal diseases through inhalation. Which Biosafety Level (BSL) classification applies to this work environment?

A public health survey finds a higher prevalence of goiter in individuals living at higher altitudes. Further analysis reveals that iodine-deficient soil and water in these regions are the primary contributors. What type of association does this represent?
Which of the following interventions falls under primary prevention? Cochlear implant TB treatment Pap smear Self breast examination Immunization
What does the p-value represent in hypothesis testing?

options.label: A
options.text: Not rejecting a null hypothesis when it is true

options.label: B
options.text: Rejecting a null hypothesis when it is true

options.label: C
options.text: Not rejecting a null hypothesis when it is false

options.label: D
options.text: Rejecting a null hypothesis when it is false

questions.correct_answer: B. Rejecting a null hypothesis when it is true
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Rejecting a null hypothesis when it is true

questions.text: In a study comparing the proportion of underweight students in two different classes, one class has three-fourths of the students underweight, and the other class has two-thirds of the students anemic. Which statistical test should be applied to assess the significance of the difference in proportions?

In a public health study, researchers want to explore and forecast creative solutions for a specific problem using a panel of experts who provide their opinions anonymously, followed by rounds of discussion until a consensus is achieved. Which of the following is the most appropriate method for this scenario?
What is the daily recommended energy intake for an infant aged 0-6 months?
A pregnant woman in her first trimester develops chloroquine-resistant Plasmodium falciparum malaria in state of Maharashtra. Which of the following drugs should be avoided in her treatment?
